player::get_nbt.desc:
**Name:** creative_plus.action.player_get_nbt.name\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** creative_plus.action.player_get_nbt.description

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = player::get_nbt("path", "ANY_VALUE");

//Or dry by positionals

player::get_nbt(`variable`, "path", "ANY_VALUE");

//Or dry by keywords

player::get_nbt(variable=`variable`, path="path", value_type="ANY_VALUE");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID              | Type                                                                                               | Description                                                       |
| :--------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- |
| variable        | Variable\[Any Value\]                                                                              | creative_plus.action.player_get_nbt.argument.variable.name        |
| path            | Text                                                                                               | creative_plus.action.player_get_nbt.argument.path.name            |
| value_type      | Marker                                                                                             | creative_plus.action.player_get_nbt.argument.value_type.name      |
|                 | **ANY_VALUE** - creative_plus.action.player_get_nbt.argument.value_type.enum.any_value.name        |                                                                   |
|                 | **NBT_STRING** - creative_plus.action.player_get_nbt.argument.value_type.enum.nbt_string.name      |                                                                   |

player::give_experience.desc:
**Name:** Give Experience\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Gives a player an experience.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::give_experience(1, "LEVEL");

//Or dry by keywords

player::give_experience(experience=1, mode="LEVEL");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID              | Type                                                 | Description      |
| :--------- | :---------------------------------------------- | :---------- |
| experience      | Number                                               | Give Amount      |
| mode            | Marker                                               | Give Type        |
|                 | **LEVEL** - As Level                                 |                  |
|                 | **LEVEL_PERCENTAGE** - As a percentage of level      |                  |
|                 | **POINTS** - As experience points                    |                  |

player::give_items.desc:
**Name:** Give Item\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Gives players items from a chest. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::give_items([item("stick"), item("stick")], 1); //Or dry by keywords player::give_items(items=[item("stick"), item("stick")], amount=1); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :----- | :------------ | :------------------------------------------------ | | items | Array\[Item\] | Items
The argument supports list decomposition | | amount | Number | Amount of items to give out |

player::give_potion_effect.desc:
**Name:** Give Potion Effect\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Gives the selected effects to a player. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::give_potion_effect([potion("slow_falling"), potion("slow_falling")], "FALSE", "FALSE", "AMBIENT"); //Or dry by keywords player::give_potion_effect(potions=[potion("slow_falling"), potion("slow_falling")], show_icon="FALSE", overwrite="FALSE", particle_mode="AMBIENT"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------------ | :------------------------ | :---------------------------------------------------------- | | potions | Array\[Potion\] | Effects to Give
The argument supports list decomposition | | show_icon | Marker | Show Effect Icon | | | **FALSE** - None | | | | **TRUE** - Yes | | | overwrite | Marker | Overwrite existing effects | | | **FALSE** - None | | | | **TRUE** - Yes | | | particle_mode | Marker | Give Particles | | | **AMBIENT** - Transparent | | | | **NONE** - None | | | | **REGULAR** - Yes | |

player::give_random_item.desc:
**Name:** Give a Random Item\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Gives a player a random item or a stack of items in a chest. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::give_random_item([item("stick"), item("stick")]); //Or dry by keywords player::give_random_item(items=[item("stick"), item("stick")]); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :---- | :------------ | :-------------------------------------------------------- | | items | Array\[Item\] | Items to Pick
The argument supports list decomposition |

player::heal.desc:
**Name:** Heal Player\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Heals a player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::heal(1);

//Or dry by keywords

player::heal(heal=1);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID        | Type        | Description                        |
| :--- | :----- | :---------------------------- |
| heal      | Number      | Amount of Half Hearts to Heal      |

player::hide_entity.desc:
**Name:** Hide Entity From Player\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Hides the specified entity from the player. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::hide_entity(["name_or_uuid", "name_or_uuid"], "FALSE"); //Or dry by keywords player::hide_entity(name_or_uuid=["name_or_uuid", "name_or_uuid"], hide="FALSE"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :----------- | :------------------ | :--------------------------------------------------------------------- | | name_or_uuid | Array\[Text\] | Name or UUID of the entity
The argument supports list decomposition | | hide | Marker | Hide | | | **FALSE** - Disable | | | | **TRUE** - Enable | |

player::hide_scoreboard.desc:
**Name:** Hide Scoreboard\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Hides the player's current scoreboard.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::hide_scoreboard();
```

player::kick.desc:
**Name:** Kick Player\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Kicks the player out of the world.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::kick();
```

player::launch_forward.desc:
**Name:** Launch Forward\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Launches the player forward or backward in the direction they are looking, depending on their strength.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::launch_forward(1, "FALSE", "YAW");

//Or dry by keywords

player::launch_forward(power=1, increment="FALSE", launch_axis="YAW");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID               | Type                              | Description                   |
| :---------- | :--------------------------- | :----------------------- |
| power            | Number                            | Knock Up Power                |
| increment        | Marker                            | Consider current inertia      |
|                  | **FALSE** - Disabled              |                               |
|                  | **TRUE** - Enabled                |                               |
| launch_axis      | Marker                            | Launch Axis                   |
|                  | **YAW** - Horizontal Only         |                               |
|                  | **YAW_AND_PITCH** - All Axis      |                               |

player::launch_projectile.desc:
**Name:** Launch Projectile\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Launch a projectile from the player's location.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::launch_projectile(item("stick"), location(0,0,0,0,0), "name", 1, 2, particle("fire"));

//Or dry by keywords

player::launch_projectile(projectile=item("stick"), location=location(0,0,0,0,0), name="name", speed=1, inaccuracy=2, trail=particle("fire"));
```

**Arguments:**

| ID              | Type                 | Description                                                           |
| :--------- | :-------------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------- |
| projectile      | Item                 | Projectile to Launch                                                  |
| location        | Location             | Launch Location                                                       |
| name            | Text                 | Projectile Name                                                       |
| speed           | Number               | Projectile Speed                                                      |
| inaccuracy      | Number               | Projectile deflection (0 to keep the projectile flying straight)      |
| trail           | Particle Effect      | The trail that the projectile will leave                              |

player::launch_to_location.desc:
**Name:** Launch to Location\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Launches the player to the selected location.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::launch_to_location(location(0,0,0,0,0), 1, "FALSE");

//Or dry by keywords

player::launch_to_location(location=location(0,0,0,0,0), power=1, increment="FALSE");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID             | Type                      | Description                   |
| :-------- | :------------------- | :----------------------- |
| location       | Location                  | End Position                  |
| power          | Number                    | Launch Power                  |
| increment      | Marker                    | Consider current inertia      |
|                | **FALSE** - Disabled      |                               |
|                | **TRUE** - Enabled        |                               |

player::launch_up.desc:
**Name:** Launch Up\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Tosses the player up or down based on strength.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::launch_up(1, "FALSE");

//Or dry by keywords

player::launch_up(power=1, increment="FALSE");
```

| ID             | Type                      | Description                   |
| :-------- | :------------------- | :----------------------- |
| power          | Number                    | Power                         |
| increment      | Marker                    | Consider current inertia      |
|                | **FALSE** - Disabled      |                               |
|                | **TRUE** - Enabled        |                               |

player::leave_vehicle.desc:
**Name:** Dismount\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Dismounts a player from a vehicle or entity.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::leave_vehicle();
```

player::load_inventory.desc:
**Name:** Load Saved Inventory\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Loads the selected saved inventory.\
**Additional info:**\
  If there is no saved inventory, the player's inventory will be cleared.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::load_inventory();
```

| disguise                    | Marker                                                                                                                                    | creative_plus.action.player_mimic_disguise_from_entity.argument.disguise.name                    |
|                             | **ALL** - creative_plus.action.player_mimic_disguise_from_entity.argument.disguise.enum.all.name                                          |                                                                                                  |
|                             | **EVERYONE_BUT_NOT_SELF** - creative_plus.action.player_mimic_disguise_from_entity.argument.disguise.enum.everyone_but_not_self.name      |                                                                                                  |
|                             | **ONLY_SELF** - creative_plus.action.player_mimic_disguise_from_entity.argument.disguise.enum.only_self.name                              |                                                                                                  |
| remove_original_entity      | Marker                                                                                                                                    | creative_plus.action.player_mimic_disguise_from_entity.argument.remove_original_entity.name      |
|                             | **TRUE** - creative_plus.action.player_mimic_disguise_from_entity.argument.remove_original_entity.enum.true.name                          |                                                                                                  |
|                             | **FALSE** - creative_plus.action.player_mimic_disguise_from_entity.argument.remove_original_entity.enum.false.name                        |                                                                                                  |

player::open_book.desc:

player::open_container_inventory.desc:

player::open_ender_chest.desc:

**Description:** creative_plus.action.player_open_ender_chest.description

```justcode
player::open_ender_chest();
```

player::open_working_menu.desc:

|                | **STONECUTTER** - creative_plus.action.player_open_working_menu.argument.menu_type.enum.stonecutter.name                  |                                                                            |
|                | **ENCHANTMENT** - creative_plus.action.player_open_working_menu.argument.menu_type.enum.enchantment.name                  |                                                                            |

player::play_animation_action.desc:
**Name:** Play Animation to Player\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Plays a specific animation for the player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::play_animation_action("DAMAGE");

//Or dry by keywords

player::play_animation_action(animation="DAMAGE");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID             | Type                                  | Description         |
| :-------- | :------------------------------- | :------------- |
| animation      | Marker                                | Animation Type      |
|                | **DAMAGE** - Taking Damage            |                     |
|                | **JUMPSCARE** - Ancient Guardian      |                     |
|                | **TOTEM** - Totem                     |                     |
|                | **WAKE_UP** - Wake Up From Bed        |                     |

player::play_hurt_animation.desc:
**Name:** Play Hurt Animation\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Plays a hurt animation for the player with a given angle.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::play_hurt_animation(1);

//Or dry by keywords

player::play_hurt_animation(yaw=1);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID       | Type        | Description                                |
| :-- | :----- | :------------------------------------ |
| yaw      | Number      | Received damage angle (from 0 to 360)      |

player::play_sound.desc:
**Name:** Play Sound\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Plays a sound to the player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::play_sound(sound("entity.zombie.hurt"), location(0,0,0,0,0));

//Or dry by keywords

player::play_sound(sound=sound("entity.zombie.hurt"), location=location(0,0,0,0,0));
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type          | Description         |
| :------- | :------- | :------------- |
| sound         | Sound         | Sound to Play       |
| location      | Location      | Sound Location      |

player::play_sound_from_entity.desc:
**Name:** Play sound from entity\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Plays a sound from the specified entity to the player.\ **Additional info:**\   Stereo sounds will not play. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::play_sound_from_entity("name_or_uuid", [sound("entity.zombie.hurt"), sound("entity.zombie.hurt")]); //Or dry by keywords player::play_sound_from_entity(name_or_uuid="name_or_uuid", sounds=[sound("entity.zombie.hurt"), sound("entity.zombie.hurt")]); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :----------- | :------------- | :-------------------------------------------------------- | | name_or_uuid | Text | Entity name or UUID | | sounds | Array\[Sound\] | Sound to play
The argument supports list decomposition |

player::play_sound_sequence.desc:
**Name:** Play Sound Sequence\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Plays a sequence of sounds to the player with a delay between each sound. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::play_sound_sequence([sound("entity.zombie.hurt"), sound("entity.zombie.hurt")], location(0,0,0,0,0), 1); //Or dry by keywords player::play_sound_sequence(sounds=[sound("entity.zombie.hurt"), sound("entity.zombie.hurt")], location=location(0,0,0,0,0), delay=1); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------- | :------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------- | | sounds | Array\[Sound\] | Playable Sounds
The argument supports list decomposition | | location | Location | Sound Location | | delay | Number | Delay in ticks |

player::randomized_teleport.desc:
**Name:** Randomized Teleport\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Teleports the player to a random location. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::randomized_teleport([location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0)], "FALSE", "FALSE", "FALSE"); //Or dry by keywords player::randomized_teleport(locations=[location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0)], keep_rotation="FALSE", keep_velocity="FALSE", dismount="FALSE"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------------ | :------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------- | | locations | Array\[Location\] | Teleport Locations
The argument supports list decomposition | | keep_rotation | Marker | Keep current rotation | | | **FALSE** - Disabled | | | | **TRUE** - Enabled | | | keep_velocity | Marker | Keep Momentum | | | **FALSE** - Keep Off | | | | **TRUE** - Enable | | | dismount | Marker | Dismount after teleporting | | | **FALSE** - None | | | | **TRUE** - Yes | |

player::redirect_world.desc:
**Name:** Send to Another World\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Redirects the player to the world with the given ID.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::redirect_world("world_id");

//Or dry by keywords

player::redirect_world(world_id="world_id");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type      | Description      |
| :------- | :--- | :---------- |
| world_id      | Text      | World ID         |

player::remove_boss_bar.desc:
**Name:** Remove Boss Bar\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Removes an existing boss bar from a specific player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::remove_boss_bar("id");

//Or dry by keywords

player::remove_boss_bar(id="id");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID      | Type      | Description      |
| :- | :--- | :---------- |
| id      | Text      | Boss Bar ID      |

player::remove_disguise.desc:
**Name:** Remove Disguise\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Removes a player's disguise.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::remove_disguise();
```

player::remove_display_blocks.desc:
**Name:** Remove Display Blocks\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Removes all client-sided display blocks (maximum size: 500).

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::remove_display_blocks(location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0));

//Or dry by keywords

player::remove_display_blocks(pos_1=location(0,0,0,0,0), pos_2=location(0,0,0,0,0));
```

**Arguments:**

| ID         | Type          | Description        |
| :---- | :------- | :------------ |
| pos_1      | Location      | First corner       |
| pos_2      | Location      | Second corner      |

player::remove_inventory_menu_row.desc:
**Name:** Remove Inventory Menu Rows\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Removes one or more rows from the "Chest" inventory.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::remove_inventory_menu_row(1, "BUTTON");

//Or dry by keywords

player::remove_inventory_menu_row(size=1, position="BUTTON");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type                               | Description         |
| :------- | :---------------------------- | :------------- |
| size          | Number                             | Number of Rows      |
| position      | Marker                             | Row Position        |
|               | **BUTTON** - Remove Row Below      |                     |
|               | **TOP** - Remove Top Row           |                     |

player::remove_items.desc:
**Name:** Remove Items\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Removes the specified items from the player's inventory. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::remove_items([item("stick"), item("stick")]); //Or dry by keywords player::remove_items(items=[item("stick"), item("stick")]); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :---- | :------------ | :---------------------------------------------------------- | | items | Array\[Item\] | Items to Remove
The argument supports list decomposition |

player::remove_pose.desc:
**Name:** Reset Player Pose\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Resets a player's pose.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::remove_pose();
```

player::remove_potion_effect.desc:
**Name:** Remove Potion Effect\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Removes the selected effects from a player. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::remove_potion_effect([potion("slow_falling"), potion("slow_falling")]); //Or dry by keywords player::remove_potion_effect(potions=[potion("slow_falling"), potion("slow_falling")]); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------ | :-------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------ | | potions | Array\[Potion\] | Effects to Remove
The argument supports list decomposition |

player::remove_self_disguise.desc:
**Name:** Remove Self Disguise\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Removes a player's disguise that only they can see.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::remove_self_disguise();
```

player::remove_skin.desc:
**Name:** Clear Skin\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Returns the normal skin of the event target.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::remove_skin();
```

player::remove_world_border.desc:
**Name:** Remove World Border\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Set the player's world border to the default value.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::remove_world_border();
```

player::replace_items.desc:
**Name:** Replace Items\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Replaces the specified items in the inventory with a specific item. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::replace_items([item("stick"), item("stick")], item("stick"), 1); //Or dry by keywords player::replace_items(items=[item("stick"), item("stick")], replace=item("stick"), count=1); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------ | :------------ | :-------------------------------------------------------- | | items | Array\[Item\] | Replace Items
The argument supports list decomposition | | replace | Item | Replacement Item | | count | Number | Number of Items to Replace |

player::reset_weather.desc:
**Name:** Reset Weather\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Resets player weather

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::reset_weather();
```

player::ride_entity.desc:
**Name:** Ride an Entity\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Rides the player on an entity or another player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::ride_entity("name_or_uuid");

//Or dry by keywords

player::ride_entity(name_or_uuid="name_or_uuid");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                | Type      | Description                     |
| :----------- | :--- | :------------------------- |
| name_or_uuid      | Text      | Name or UUID of the target      |

player::save_inventory.desc:
**Name:** Save Current Inventory\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Saves the player's current inventory. It can be loaded later using 'Load Saved Inventory'.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::save_inventory();
```

player::self_disguise_as_block.desc:
**Name:** Disguise Self as a Block\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Disguises the player as a block, but this disguise is only visible to that player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::self_disguise_as_block("minecraft:oak_log[axis=x]");

//Or dry by keywords

player::self_disguise_as_block(block="minecraft:oak_log[axis=x]");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID         | Type       | Description         |
| :---- | :---- | :------------- |
| block      | Block      | Disguise Block      |

player::self_disguise_as_entity.desc:
**Name:** Disguise Self as an Entity\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Maximizes the player as an entity, but this disguise is only visible to that player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::self_disguise_as_entity(item("stick"));

//Or dry by keywords

player::self_disguise_as_entity(entity_type=item("stick"));
```

**Arguments:**

| ID               | Type      | Description             |
| :---------- | :--- | :----------------- |
| entity_type      | Item      | Entity to Disguise      |

player::self_disguise_as_item.desc:
**Name:** Disguise Self As Item\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Disguises the player as an item onto to themself.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::self_disguise_as_item(item("stick"));

//Or dry by keywords

player::self_disguise_as_item(item=item("stick"));
```

**Arguments:**

| ID        | Type      | Description              |
| :--- | :--- | :------------------ |
| item      | Item      | Item to disguise as      |

player::send_action_bar.desc:
**Name:** Send Action Bar Message\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Shows an action bar to the selected player. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::send_action_bar(["messages", "messages"], "CONCATENATION"); //Or dry by keywords player::send_action_bar(messages=["messages", "messages"], merging="CONCATENATION"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------- | :---------------------------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------- | | messages | Array\[Text\] | Action Bar Messages
The argument supports list decomposition | | merging | Marker | Merge Text | | | **CONCATENATION** - Merge | | | | **SPACES** - Space Separation | |

player::send_advancement.detail: Send an Advancement to a Player
player::send_advancement.desc:
**Name:** Send an Advancement to a Player\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Shows a player a custom advancement popup.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::send_advancement(item("stick"), "name", "CHALLENGE");

//Or dry by keywords

player::send_advancement(icon=item("stick"), name="name", frame="CHALLENGE");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID         | Type                           | Description           |
| :---- | :------------------------ | :--------------- |
| icon       | Item                           | Icon                  |
| name       | Text                           | Name                  |
| frame      | Marker                         | Achievement Type      |
|            | **CHALLENGE** - Challenge      |                       |
|            | **GOAL** - Goal                |                       |
|            | **TASK** - Regular             |                       |

player::send_break_animation.desc:
**Name:** Show Block Break Animation\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Shows a block breaking animation for the player without affecting other players. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::send_break_animation([location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0)], 1); //Or dry by keywords player::send_break_animation(locations=[location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0)], stage=1); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :-------- | :---------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------- | | locations | Array\[Location\] | Block Locations
The argument supports list decomposition | | stage | Number | Block Break Level (0 to 10) |

player::send_dialogue.desc:
**Name:** Dialogue\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Sends multiple chat messages to selected players with a delay after each message. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::send_dialogue(["messages", "messages"], 1); //Or dry by keywords player::send_dialogue(messages=["messages", "messages"], delay=1); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------- | :------------ | :------------------------------------------------------- | | messages | Array\[Text\] | Text to send
The argument supports list decomposition | | delay | Number | Delay between messages |

player::send_hover.desc:
**Name:** Send Hover Message\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Sends a message to the selected player. When a player 'hovers' over it, a second message appears.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::send_hover("message", "hover");

//Or dry by keywords

player::send_hover(message="message", hover="hover");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID           | Type      | Description          |
| :------ | :--- | :-------------- |
| message      | Text      | Message to Send      |
| hover        | Text      | Hover Message        |

player::message.desc:
**Name:** Send Message\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Sends a message to the chat to the specified players. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::message(["messages", "messages"], "CONCATENATION"); //Or dry by keywords player::message(messages=["messages", "messages"], merging="CONCATENATION"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------- | :---------------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------- | | messages | Array\[Text\] | Text to send
The argument supports list decomposition | | merging | Marker | Merge Text | | | **CONCATENATION** - Merge | | | | **SEPARATE_LINES** - Separate Lines | | | | **SPACES** - Space Separation | |

player::send_minimessage.desc:
**Name:** Send a MiniMessage\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Sends a MiniMessage message to a player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::send_minimessage("minimessage");

//Or dry by keywords

player::send_minimessage(minimessage="minimessage");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID               | Type      | Description                     |
| :---------- | :--- | :------------------------- |
| minimessage      | Text      | MiniMessage Format Message      |

player::send_title.desc:
**Name:** Send Title\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Shows two captions to the screen for the selected player - a title and a subtitle.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::send_title("title", "subtitle", 1, 2, 3);

//Or dry by keywords

player::send_title(title="title", subtitle="subtitle", fade_in=1, stay=2, fade_out=3);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type        | Description                 |
| :------- | :----- | :--------------------- |
| title         | Text        | Title Text                  |
| subtitle      | Text        | Subtitle Text               |
| fade_in       | Number      | Fade Time in Ticks          |
| stay          | Number      | Tick Delay                  |
| fade_out      | Number      | Fade Out Time in Ticks      |

player::set_absorption_health.desc:
**Name:** Set Bonus Health\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Sets a player's bonus health.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::set_absorption_health(1);

//Or dry by keywords

player::set_absorption_health(health=1);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID          | Type        | Description                 |
| :----- | :----- | :--------------------- |
| health      | Number      | Amount of Extra Health      |

player::set_air_ticks.desc:
**Name:** Set Remaining Air\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Sets the player's remaining air.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::set_air_ticks(1);

//Or dry by keywords

player::set_air_ticks(ticks=1);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID         | Type        | Description                             |
| :---- | :----- | :--------------------------------- |
| ticks      | Number      | Amount of Air Remaining (in ticks)      |

player::set_allow_flying.desc:

**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Sets the flying permission for the player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::set_allow_flying("FALSE");

//Or dry by keywords

player::set_allow_flying(allow_flying="FALSE");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                | Type                | Description      |
| :----------- | :------------- | :---------- |
| allow_flying      | Marker              | Can fly          |
|                   | **FALSE** - No      |                  |
|                   | **TRUE** - Yes      |                  |

player::set_armor.desc:

**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Sets the player's armor.\
**Additional info:**\
  Any item or block will appear on the head when placed in the helmet slot.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::set_armor(item("stick"), item("stick"), item("stick"), item("stick"));

//Or dry by keywords

player::set_armor(helmet=item("stick"), chestplate=item("stick"), leggings=item("stick"), boots=item("stick"));
```

**Arguments:**

| ID              | Type      | Description      |
| :--------- | :--- | :---------- |
| helmet          | Item      | Helmet           |
| chestplate      | Item      | Chestplate       |
| leggings        | Item      | Leggings         |
| boots           | Item      | Boots            |

player::set_arrows_in_body.desc:
**Name:** Set Arrows On Player\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Displays a set number of arrows on the player.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::set_arrows_in_body(1);

//Or dry by keywords

player::set_arrows_in_body(amount=1);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID          | Type        | Description                      |
| :----- | :----- | :-------------------------- |
| amount      | Number      | Number of arrows to display      |

player::set_attack_speed.desc:
**Name:** Set Attack Speed\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Sets the player's attack speed.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::set_attack_speed(1);

//Or dry by keywords

player::set_attack_speed(speed=1);
```

|                | **TRUE** - Open         |                     |

|             | **DIGGING** - Digging (For Guardian)                                                      |                   |
|             | **DYING** - Death                                                                         |                   |
|             | **EMERGING** - Emerging from the Earth (for Guardian)                                     |                   |
|             | **FALL_FLYING** - Elytra Flying                                                           |                   |
|             | **INHALING** - Inhalation (for Vortex)                                                    |                   |
|             | **LONG_JUMPING** - Long Jump                                                              |                   |
|             | **ROARING** - Roar (for Guardian)                                                         |                   |
|             | **SHOOTING** - Shooting (for Vortex)                                                      |                   |
|             | **SITTING** - Sitting                                                                     |                   |
|             | **SLEEPING** - Sleeping                                                                   |                   |
|             | **SLIDING** - Sliding (for Vortex)                                                        |                   |
|             | **SNEAKING** - creative_plus.action.player_set_pose.argument.pose.enum.sneaking.name      |                   |
|             | **SNIFFING** - Sniffing (for Guardian)                                                    |                   |
|             | **SPIN_ATTACK** - Use Thrust                                                              |                   |
|             | **STANDING** - Normal State                                                               |                   |
|             | **SWIMMING** - Swimming                                                                   |                   |
|             | **USING_TONGUE** - Using Tongue (For Toads)                                               |                   |
| locked      | Marker                                                                                    | Lock Pose         |
|             | **FALSE** - Disable                                                                       |                   |
|             | **TRUE** - Enable                                                                         |                   |

player::show_debug_marker.desc:

**Description:** Shows the player a debug marker at the location at the specified time. Red and blue colors work for players on version 1.19.4 and above.\
**Additional info:**\
  Leave the "Display Name" argument blank to hide the name completely.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::show_debug_marker(location(0,0,0,0,0), "name", 1, 2, 3, 4, 5);

//Or dry by keywords

player::show_debug_marker(location=location(0,0,0,0,0), name="name", duration=1, red=2, green=3, blue=4, alpha=5);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type          | Description                              |
| :------- | :------- | :---------------------------------- |
| location      | Location      | Spawn Location                           |
| name          | Text          | Display Name                             |
| duration      | Number        | Duration in milliseconds (optional)      |
| red           | Number        | Color Red (0 to 100)                     |
| green         | Number        | Green Color (0 to 100)                   |
| blue          | Number        | Color Blue (0 to 100)                    |
| alpha         | Number        | Transparency (0 to 100)                  |

player::show_inventory_menu.desc:
**Name:** Show Inventory Menu\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Shows the player an inventory menu with selected items and title. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::show_inventory_menu([item("stick"), item("stick")], "name", "custom_id", "ANVIL"); //Or dry by keywords player::show_inventory_menu(items=[item("stick"), item("stick")], name="name", custom_id="custom_id", inventory_type="ANVIL"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------------- | :------------------------------------ | :---------------------------------------------------------------------- | | items | Array\[Item\] | Inventory Items
The argument supports list decomposition | | name | Text | Inventory name | | custom_id | Text | creative_plus.action.player_show_inventory_menu.argument.custom_id.name | | inventory_type | Marker | Inventory Type | | | **ANVIL** - Anvil | | | | **BARREL** - Barrel | | | | **BEACON** - Beacon | | | | **BLAST_FURNACE** - Smelter | | | | **BREWING** - Potion Brewing | | | | **CARTOGRAPHY** - Cartographer's Desk | | | | **CHEST** - Chest | | | | **COMPOSTER** - Composter | | | | **CRAFTER** - Crafter | | | | **CRAFTING** - Not opened | | | | **CREATIVE** - Creative Inventory | | | | **DISPENSER** - Dispenser | | | | **DROPPER** - Dropper | | | | **ENCHANTING** - Enchanting Table | | | | **ENDER_CHEST** - Ender Chest | | | | **FURNACE** - Furnace | | | | **GRINDSTONE** - Grindstone | | | | **HOPPER** - Hopper | | | | **LECTERN** - Pulpit | | | | **LOOM** - Loom | | | | **MERCHANT** - Merchant | | | | **PLAYER** - Player Inventory | | | | **SHULKER_BOX** - Shulker Box | | | | **SMITHING** - Blacksmith's Table | | | | **SMOKER** - Smoker | | | | **STONECUTTER** - Stonecutter | | | | **WORKBENCH** - Workbench | |

The argument supports list decomposition |

**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Stops all sounds from the specified source.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::stop_sounds_by_source("AMBIENT");

//Or dry by keywords

player::stop_sounds_by_source(source="AMBIENT");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID          | Type                                            | Description       |
| :----- | :----------------------------------------- | :----------- |
| source      | Marker                                          | Sound Source      |
|             | **AMBIENT** - Environment (ambient)             |                   |
|             | **BLOCK** - Blocks                              |                   |
|             | **HOSTILE** - Hostile creatures (hostile)       |                   |
|             | **MASTER** - General (master)                   |                   |
|             | **MUSIC** - Music (music)                       |                   |
|             | **NEUTRAL** - Friendly Creatures (neutral)      |                   |
|             | **PLAYER** - Players (player)                   |                   |
|             | **RECORD** - Music blocks (record)              |                   |
|             | **VOICE** - Voice/Speech (voice)                |                   |
|             | **WEATHER** - Weather (weather)                 |                   |

|                | **MAIN** - Main      |                  |
|                | **OFF** - Minor      |                  |

player::teleport.desc:
**Name:** Teleport\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Teleports the player to the selected location.\
**Additional info:**\
  Closes an open inventory menu.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
player::teleport(location(0,0,0,0,0), "FALSE", "FALSE", "FALSE");

//Or dry by keywords

player::teleport(location=location(0,0,0,0,0), keep_rotation="FALSE", keep_velocity="FALSE", dismount="FALSE");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                 | Type                      | Description                     |
| :------------ | :------------------- | :------------------------- |
| location           | Location                  | New Position                    |
| keep_rotation      | Marker                    | Keep Current Rotation           |
|                    | **FALSE** - Disabled      |                                 |
|                    | **TRUE** - Enabled        |                                 |
| keep_velocity      | Marker                    | Keep Momentum                   |
|                    | **FALSE** - Keep Off      |                                 |
|                    | **TRUE** - Enable         |                                 |
| dismount           | Marker                    | Dismount After Teleporting      |
|                    | **FALSE** - None          |                                 |
|                    | **TRUE** - Yes            |                                 |

player::teleport_sequence.desc:
**Name:** Teleport Sequence\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Teleports the player between locations with the specified delay. **Usage example:** ```justcode player::teleport_sequence([location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0)], 1); //Or dry by keywords player::teleport_sequence(locations=[location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0)], delay=1); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :-------- | :---------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------- | | locations | Array\[Location\] | Teleport Locations
The argument supports list decomposition | | delay | Number | Delay in ticks |

repeat::adjacently.desc:
**Name:** Repeat Adjacently\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Assigns the current location to the specified variable among blocks adjacent to the specified location.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
repeat::adjacently(location(0,0,0,0,0), "FALSE", "FALSE", "ADJACENT"){`variable`->
    player::message("Code in cycle");
}

//Or dry by keywords

repeat::adjacently(variable=`variable`, origin=location(0,0,0,0,0), change_rotation="FALSE", include_self="FALSE", pattern="ADJACENT"){
    player::message("Code in cycle");
}
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                   | Type                            | Description                                                                                 |
| :-------------- | :------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| variable             | Variable                        | To assign location                                                                          |
| origin               | Location                        | Central block                                                                               |
| change_rotation      | Marker                          | Rotate the direction of view of the current element relative to the specified location      |
|                      | **FALSE** - Don't Rotate        |                                                                                             |
|                      | **TRUE** - Rotate               |                                                                                             |
| include_self         | Marker                          | Include Center Block                                                                        |
|                      | **FALSE** - Do not include      |                                                                                             |
|                      | **TRUE** - Include              |                                                                                             |
| pattern              | Marker                          | Adjacent Block Selection Type                                                               |
|                      | **ADJACENT** - Adjacent         |                                                                                             |
|                      | **CARDINAL** - Cardinal         |                                                                                             |
|                      | **CUBE** - Cube                 |                                                                                             |
|                      | **SQUARE** - Square             |                                                                                             |

repeat::on_circle.desc:
**Name:** Repeat On Circle\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Repeat the location of each circle block with the given parameters in sequence.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
repeat::on_circle(location(0,0,0,0,0), 1, 2, vector(0,0,0), 3, "DEGREES"){`variable`->
    player::message("Code in cycle");
}

//Or dry by keywords

repeat::on_circle(variable=`variable`, center=location(0,0,0,0,0), radius=1, circle_points=2, perpendicular_to_plane=vector(0,0,0), start_angle=3, angle_unit="DEGREES"){
    player::message("Code in cycle");
}
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                          | Type                       | Description                                                 |
| :--------------------- | :-------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------- |
| variable                    | Variable                   | To assign location                                          |
| center                      | Location                   | Circle Center                                               |
| radius                      | Number                     | Circle Radius                                               |
| circle_points               | Number                     | Number of Circle Points                                     |
| perpendicular_to_plane      | Vector                     | Plane normal to which the circle will be perpendicular      |
| start_angle                 | Number                     | Start Angle                                                 |
| angle_unit                  | Marker                     | Angle Type                                                  |
|                             | **DEGREES** - Degrees      |                                                             |
|                             | **RADIANS** - Radians      |                                                             |

repeat::on_path.desc:
**Name:** Repeat On Path\ **Action type:** Action without value\ **Description:** Repeat from one location to another in increments, assigning the current location to the specified variable. **Usage example:** ```justcode repeat::on_path(1, [location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0)], "FALSE"){`variable`-> player::message("Code in cycle"); } //Or dry by keywords repeat::on_path(variable=`variable`, step=1, locations=[location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0)], rotation="FALSE"){ player::message("Code in cycle"); } ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :-------- | :--------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------- | | variable | Variable | To assign location | | step | Number | Distance between points | | locations | Array\[Location\] | Line End Locations
The argument supports list decomposition | | rotation | Marker | Keep rotation of specified location | | | **FALSE** - Don't Save | | | | **TRUE** - Keep | |

repeat::on_sphere.desc:
**Name:** Repeat On Sphere\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Sequentially returns the location of each point on a sphere with the specified parameters.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
repeat::on_sphere(location(0,0,0,0,0), 1, 2, "INWARDS"){`variable`->
    player::message("Code in cycle");
}

//Or dry by keywords

repeat::on_sphere(variable=`variable`, center=location(0,0,0,0,0), radius=1, points=2, rotate_location="INWARDS"){
    player::message("Code in cycle");
}
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                   | Type                                   | Description                              |
| :-------------- | :-------------------------------- | :---------------------------------- |
| variable             | Variable                               | Current location of point on sphere      |
| center               | Location                               | Sphere Center                            |
| radius               | Number                                 | Sphere Radius                            |
| points               | Number                                 | Number of Points                         |
| rotate_location      | Marker                                 | Point Location Direction                 |
|                      | **INWARDS** - Center                   |                                          |
|                      | **NO_CHANGES** - Same as Location      |                                          |
|                      | **OUTWARDS** - From Center             |                                          |


**Arguments:**

| ID                  | Type                               | Description            |
| :------------- | :---------------------------- | :---------------- |
| location            | Location                           | Center Location        |
| selection_size      | Number                             | Number of Targets      |
| ignore_y_axis       | Marker                             | Ignore Y Axis          |
|                     | **FALSE** - Don't Ignore           |                        |
|                     | **TRUE** - Ignore                  |                        |
| compare_mode        | Marker                             | Compare Type           |
|                     | **FARTHEST** - Farthest            |                        |
|                     | **NEAREST** - Nearest Targets      |                        |

select::filter_by_raycast.desc:
**Name:** Filter By Raycast\
**Action type:** Action without value\
**Description:** Keep only the targets hit by the launched beam in the selection. Beamwidth only works on entities (increases or decreases creature hitboxes).

**Usage example:**
```justcode
select::filter_by_raycast(`variable`, location(0,0,0,0,0), 1, 2, 3, "FALSE", "FALSE", "ALWAYS");

//Or dry by keywords

select::filter_by_raycast(variable=`variable`, origin=location(0,0,0,0,0), max_distance=1, ray_size=2, selection_size=3, consider_blocks="FALSE", ignore_passable_blocks="FALSE", fluid_collision_mode="ALWAYS");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                          | Type                                              | Description                 |
| :--------------------- | :------------------------------------------- | :--------------------- |
| variable                    | Variable                                          | Ray End Point               |
| origin                      | Location                                          | Ray Origin                  |
| max_distance                | Number                                            | Ray Length                  |
| ray_size                    | Number                                            | Ray Width                   |
| selection_size              | Number                                            | Selection Size              |
| consider_blocks             | Marker                                            | Consider Blocks             |
|                             | **FALSE** - Don't Consider                        |                             |
|                             | **TRUE** - Consider                               |                             |
| ignore_passable_blocks      | Marker                                            | Ignore Passable Blocks      |
|                             | **FALSE** - Don't Ignore                          |                             |
|                             | **TRUE** - Ignore                                 |                             |
| fluid_collision_mode        | Marker                                            | Ignore Fluid                |
|                             | **ALWAYS** - Don't Ignore                         |                             |
|                             | **NEVER** - Totally Ignore                        |                             |
|                             | **SOURCE_ONLY** - Consider fluid source only      |                             |

variable::add_item_potion_effects.desc:
**Name:** Set Item Potion Effects\ **Action type:** An action that returns a value\ **Description:** Sets the potion effects of an item and assigns the result to a variable. **Usage example:** ```justcode `variable` = variable::add_item_potion_effects([potion("slow_falling"), potion("slow_falling")], item("stick"), "FALSE", "FALSE", "AMBIENT"); //Or from the object `variable` = item("stick").add_item_potion_effects([potion("slow_falling"), potion("slow_falling")], "FALSE", "FALSE", "AMBIENT"); //Or dry by positionals variable::add_item_potion_effects(`variable`, [potion("slow_falling"), potion("slow_falling")], item("stick"), "FALSE", "FALSE", "AMBIENT"); //Or dry by keywords variable::add_item_potion_effects(variable=`variable`, potions=[potion("slow_falling"), potion("slow_falling")], item=item("stick"), overwrite="FALSE", show_icon="FALSE", particle_mode="AMBIENT"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------------ | :------------------------ | :--------------------------------------------------------- | | variable | Variable\[Item\] | Variable to assign | | potions | Array\[Potion\] | Potion Effects
The argument supports list decomposition | | item | Item | Item | | overwrite | Marker | Overwrite existing effects | | | **FALSE** - None | | | | **TRUE** - Yes | | | show_icon | Marker | Show Effect Icon | | | **FALSE** - None | | | | **TRUE** - Yes | | | particle_mode | Marker | Show Particles | | | **AMBIENT** - Transparent | | | | **NONE** - None | | | | **REGULAR** - Yes | |

variable::align_location.desc:
**Name:** Round Location\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** Rounds the location to the center or corner of the block and assigns the result to a variable.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::align_location(location(0,0,0,0,0), "KEEP", "ALL", "BLOCK_CENTER");

//Or from the object

`variable` = location(0,0,0,0,0).align_location("KEEP", "ALL", "BLOCK_CENTER");

//Or dry by positionals

variable::align_location(`variable`, location(0,0,0,0,0), "KEEP", "ALL", "BLOCK_CENTER");

//Or dry by keywords

variable::align_location(variable=`variable`, location=location(0,0,0,0,0), rotation_mode="KEEP", coordinates_mode="ALL", align_mode="BLOCK_CENTER");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                    | Type                                 | Description             |
| :--------------- | :------------------------------ | :----------------- |
| variable              | Variable\[Location\]                 | Variable to assign      |
| location              | Location                             | Location                |
| rotation_mode         | Marker                               | Keep Rotation           |
|                       | **KEEP** - Enable                    |                         |
|                       | **REMOVE** - Disable                 |                         |
| coordinates_mode      | Marker                               | Coordinate Type         |
|                       | **ALL** - All Coordinates            |                         |
|                       | **X_Z** - X and Z Coordinates        |                         |
|                       | **Y** - Y Coordinate                 |                         |
| align_mode            | Marker                               | Round Mode              |
|                       | **BLOCK_CENTER** - Block Center      |                         |
|                       | **CORNER** - To Block Corner         |                         |

variable::append_component.desc:
**Name:** Append Stylized Texts\ **Action type:** An action that returns a value\ **Description:** Appends different Styled Text together. **Usage example:** ```justcode `variable` = variable::append_component(["components", "components"], "CONCATENATION"); //Or dry by positionals variable::append_component(`variable`, ["components", "components"], "CONCATENATION"); //Or dry by keywords variable::append_component(variable=`variable`, components=["components", "components"], merging="CONCATENATION"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :--------- | :--------------------------------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------- | | variable | Variable\[Text\] | Variable to set | | components | Array\[Text\] | Texts to append
The argument supports list decomposition | | merging | Marker | Merge Text | | | **CONCATENATION** - Merging | | | | **SEPARATE_LINES** - Separate with lines | | | | **SPACES** - Spaces | |

variable::atan2.desc:
**Name:** Inverse Tangent\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** Returns the inverse tangent of the two specified numbers.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::atan2(1, 2);

//Or dry by positionals

variable::atan2(`variable`, 1, 2);

//Or dry by keywords

variable::atan2(variable=`variable`, y=1, x=2);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type                    | Description             |
| :------- | :----------------- | :----------------- |
| variable      | Variable\[Number\]      | Variable to assign      |
| y             | Number                  | First Number (y)        |
| x             | Number                  | Second Number (x)       |

variable::average.desc:
**Name:** Average\ **Action type:** An action that returns a value\ **Description:** Sets the average of numbers to a variable. **Usage example:** ```justcode `variable` = variable::average([1, 2], "ARITHMETIC"); //Or dry by positionals variable::average(`variable`, [1, 2], "ARITHMETIC"); //Or dry by keywords variable::average(variable=`variable`, value=[1, 2], type="ARITHMETIC"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------- | | variable | Variable\[Number\] | Variable to assign | | value | Array\[Number\] | Numbers to get value
The argument supports list decomposition | | type | Marker | creative_plus.action.set_variable_average.argument.type.name | | | **ARITHMETIC** - creative_plus.action.set_variable_average.argument.type.enum.arithmetic.name | | | | **GEOMETRIC** - creative_plus.action.set_variable_average.argument.type.enum.geometric.name | | | | **HARMONIC** - creative_plus.action.set_variable_average.argument.type.enum.harmonic.name | | | | **QUADRATIC** - creative_plus.action.set_variable_average.argument.type.enum.quadratic.name | |

variable::bitwise_operation.desc:
**Name:** Bitwise Operation on Numbers\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** Sets the result of a bitwise operation on numbers to a variable.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::bitwise_operation(1, 2, "AND");

//Or dry by positionals

variable::bitwise_operation(`variable`, 1, 2, "AND");

//Or dry by keywords

variable::bitwise_operation(variable=`variable`, operand1=1, operand2=2, operator="AND");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type                                                                                                                 | Description             |
| :------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :----------------- |
| variable      | Variable\[Number\]                                                                                                   | Variable to assign      |
| operand1      | Number                                                                                                               | First operand           |
| operand2      | Number                                                                                                               | Second Operand          |
| operator      | Marker                                                                                                               | Operation Type          |
|               | **AND** - And (and)                                                                                                  |                         |
|               | **LEFT_ROTATE** - creative_plus.action.set_variable_bitwise_operation.argument.operator.enum.left_rotate.name        |                         |
|               | **LEFT_SHIFT** - Shift Left (left_shift)                                                                             |                         |
|               | **NOT** - NOT (not)                                                                                                  |                         |
|               | **OR** - OR (or)                                                                                                     |                         |
|               | **RIGHT_ROTATE** - creative_plus.action.set_variable_bitwise_operation.argument.operator.enum.right_rotate.name      |                         |
|               | **RIGHT_SHIFT** - Shift Right (right_shift)                                                                          |                         |
|               | **UNSIGNED_RIGHT_SHIFT** - Unsigned Right Shift (unsigned_right_shift)                                               |                         |
|               | **XOR** - XOR (xor)                                                                                                  |                         |

variable::bytes_to_text.desc:
**Name:** Convert bytes to text\ **Action type:** An action that returns a value\ **Description:** Converts bytes to text and assigns the result to a variable. **Usage example:** ```justcode `variable` = variable::bytes_to_text([1, 2], "UTF_16"); //Or dry by positionals variable::bytes_to_text(`variable`, [1, 2], "UTF_16"); //Or dry by keywords variable::bytes_to_text(variable=`variable`, bytes=[1, 2], charset="UTF_16"); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- | | variable | Variable\[Text\] | Variable to assign | | bytes | Array\[Number\] | Bytes to convert
The argument supports list decomposition | | charset | Marker | Encoding | | | **UTF_16** - creative_plus.action.set_variable_bytes_to_text.argument.charset.enum.utf_16.name | | | | **UTF_8** - creative_plus.action.set_variable_bytes_to_text.argument.charset.enum.utf_8.name | | | | **ASCII** - ASCII | |

variable::clamp_location.desc:
**Name:** creative_plus.action.set_variable_clamp_location.name\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** creative_plus.action.set_variable_clamp_location.description

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::clamp_location(location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0), "XYZ");

//Or from the object

`variable` = location(0,0,0,0,0).clamp_location(location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0), "XYZ");

//Or dry by positionals

variable::clamp_location(`variable`, location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0), location(0,0,0,0,0), "XYZ");

//Or dry by keywords

variable::clamp_location(variable=`variable`, location=location(0,0,0,0,0), corner_1=location(0,0,0,0,0), corner_2=location(0,0,0,0,0), coordinates_mode="XYZ");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                    | Type                                                                                                    | Description                                                                          |
| :--------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| variable              | Variable\[Location\]                                                                                    | creative_plus.action.set_variable_clamp_location.argument.variable.name              |
| location              | Location                                                                                                | creative_plus.action.set_variable_clamp_location.argument.location.name              |
| corner_1              | Location                                                                                                | creative_plus.action.set_variable_clamp_location.argument.corner_1.name              |
| corner_2              | Location                                                                                                | creative_plus.action.set_variable_clamp_location.argument.corner_2.name              |
| coordinates_mode      | Marker                                                                                                  | creative_plus.action.set_variable_clamp_location.argument.coordinates_mode.name      |

variable::cosine.desc:
**Name:** Cosine\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** Returns the cosine of a number.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::cosine(1, "ARCCOSINE", "DEGREES");

//Or from the object

`variable` = (1).cosine("ARCCOSINE", "DEGREES");

//Or dry by positionals

variable::cosine(`variable`, 1, "ARCCOSINE", "DEGREES");

//Or dry by keywords

variable::cosine(variable=`variable`, number=1, variant="ARCCOSINE", input="DEGREES");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type                                                 | Description               |
| :------- | :---------------------------------------------- | :------------------- |
| variable      | Variable\[Number\]                                   | Variable to assign        |
| number        | Number                                               | Number to get cosine      |
| variant       | Marker                                               | Operation Type            |
|               | **ARCCOSINE** - Arccosine                            |                           |
|               | **COSINE** - Cosine                                  |                           |
|               | **HYPERBOLIC_ARCCOSINE** - Hyperbolic Arccosine      |                           |
|               | **HYPERBOLIC_COSINE** - Hyperbolic Cosine            |                           |
| input         | Marker                                               | Corner Type               |
|               | **DEGREES** - Degrees                                |                           |
|               | **RADIANS** - Radians                                |                           |

variable::create_list.desc:
**Name:** Create List\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** Creates a list containing the specified values.\
**Additional info:**\
  Clears the list if it already exists.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::create_list(["any value", "any value"]);

//Or dry by positionals

variable::create_list(`variable`, ["any value", "any value"]);

//Or dry by keywords

variable::create_list(variable=`variable`, values=["any value", "any value"]);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type                    | Description             |
| :------- | :----------------- | :----------------- |
| variable      | Variable\[List\]        | Variable to assign      |
| values        | Array\[Any Value\]      | Values                  |

variable::create_map.desc:
**Name:** Create Dictionary\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** Creates a dictionary from a list of keys and values and assigns the result to a variable.\
**Additional info:**\
  Clears the dictionary if it already exists.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::create_map([`keys`, `keys`], [`values`, `values`]);

//Or dry by positionals

variable::create_map(`variable`, [`keys`, `keys`], [`values`, `values`]);

//Or dry by keywords

variable::create_map(variable=`variable`, keys=[`keys`, `keys`], values=[`values`, `values`]);
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type                        | Description             |
| :------- | :--------------------- | :----------------- |
| variable      | Variable\[Dictionary\]      | Variable to assign      |
| keys          | List                        | List Keys               |
| values        | List                        | List of Values          |

variable::create_map_from_values.desc:
**Name:** Create Dictionary From Values\ **Action type:** An action that returns a value\ **Description:** Creates a dictionary from keys and values and assigns the result to a variable.\ **Additional info:**\   Clears the dictionary if it already exists. **Usage example:** ```justcode `variable` = variable::create_map_from_values(["any value", "any value"], ["any value", "any value"]); //Or dry by positionals variable::create_map_from_values(`variable`, ["any value", "any value"], ["any value", "any value"]); //Or dry by keywords variable::create_map_from_values(variable=`variable`, keys=["any value", "any value"], values=["any value", "any value"]); ``` **Arguments:** | ID | Type | Description | | :------- | :--------------------- | :------------------------------------------------- | | variable | Variable\[Dictionary\] | Variable to assign | | keys | Array\[Any Value\] | Keys | | values | Array\[Any Value\] | Values
The argument supports list decomposition |

variable::format_timestamp.desc:
**Name:** Create Time Format\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** Converts a number (milliseconds) to the specified time format and assigns the result to a variable.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::format_timestamp(1, "pattern", "zone_id", "locale", "CUSTOM");

//Or from the object

`variable` = (1).format_timestamp("pattern", "zone_id", "locale", "CUSTOM");

//Or dry by positionals

variable::format_timestamp(`variable`, 1, "pattern", "zone_id", "locale", "CUSTOM");

//Or dry by keywords

variable::format_timestamp(variable=`variable`, time=1, pattern="pattern", zone_id="zone_id", locale="locale", format="CUSTOM");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID            | Type                                                                       | Description                              |
| :------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------- | :---------------------------------- |
| variable      | Variable\[Text\]                                                           | Variable to assign                       |
| time          | Number                                                                     | Number to convert                        |
| pattern       | Text                                                                       | Time Pattern (e.g. mm\:ss)               |
| zone_id       | Text                                                                       | Timezone (GMT+1\.\.13, GMT-1\.\.13)      |
| locale        | Text                                                                       | Language (ru_RU, en_US...)               |
| format        | Marker                                                                     | Time Format                              |
|               | **CUSTOM** - Custom                                                        |                                          |
|               | **DD_MM_YYYY** - 01\/01\/1970 (dd_mm_yyyy)                                 |                                          |
|               | **DD_MM_YYYY_HH_MM_S** - 01\/01\/1970 00\:00\:00 (dd_mm_yyyy_hh_mm_s)      |                                          |
|               | **EEEE** - Thursday (eeee)                                                 |                                          |
|               | **EEE_D_MMMM** - Thu, 01 January (eee_d_mmmm)                              |                                          |
|               | **EEE_MMMM_D** - Thu, January 01 (eee_mmmm_d)                              |                                          |
|               | **HH_MM_SS** - 00\:00\:00 (hh_mm_ss)                                       |                                          |
|               | **H_H_M_M_S_S** - 00h00m00s (h_h_m_m_s_s)                                  |                                          |
|               | **H_MM_A** - 00\:00 AM (h_mm_a)                                            |                                          |
|               | **S_S** - 00.00 (s_s)                                                      |                                          |
|               | **YYYY_MM_DD** - 1970\/01\/01 (yyyy_mm_dd)                                 |                                          |
|               | **YYYY_MM_DD_HH_MM_S** - 1970\/01\/01 00\:00\:00 (yyyy_mm_dd_hh_mm_s)      |                                          |

variable::gaussian_distribution.desc:
**Name:** Normally Distributed Random Number\
**Action type:** An action that returns a value\
**Description:** Produces a random number close to the mean  with a standard deviation  with a chance given by a normal distribution plot.

**Usage example:**
```justcode
`variable` = variable::gaussian_distribution(1, 2, "FOLDER_NORMAL");

//Or dry by positionals

variable::gaussian_distribution(`variable`, 1, 2, "FOLDER_NORMAL");

//Or dry by keywords

variable::gaussian_distribution(variable=`variable`, deviant=1, mean=2, distribution="FOLDER_NORMAL");
```

**Arguments:**

| ID                | Type                                         | Description                     |
| :----------- | :-------------------------------------- | :------------------------- |
| variable          | Variable\[Number\]                           | Variable to Assign              |
| deviant           | Number                                       | Deviation of  from mean       |
| mean              | Number                                       | Mean                           |
| distribution      | Marker                                       | Type of  deviation             |
|                   | **FOLDER_NORMAL** - Side Deviation >=       |                                 |
|                   | **NORMAL** - Total Deviation                 |                                 |
